intro: Ozothamnus catadromus, commonly known as the coastal dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the coastline, where it thrives in full sun. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Ozothamnus catadromus is well adapted to coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
